relation: Join intermurals and clubs, attend Friday Night Programs, explore Downtown Naperville and the city of Chicago.
North Central Offers 3 main eating centers: 1. Kaufman Dinning Hall 2. The Cage 3. Rolland Center Boilerhouse

Residence Life on Campus is great as they staff fantastic Area Hall Directors and Resident Assistants. The Office of Residence Life puts on a program every Friday night and bring famous comedians and hypnotists to campus in addition to game nights.
North Central takes its' academics very seriously as we are a competitive liberal arts school.

Come as yourself and North Central will accept you as you are with open arms. Continue to apply for scholarships and if you have any questions, don't be afraid to ask them. Also, come to campus for a lovely tour visit!

North Central is a wonderful small private liberal arts college with a plethora of opportunities for its students such as study abroad, independent undergraduate research, Division 3 sports, intermurals, and fantastic musical opportunities. Located in the heart of Naperville, North Central is in a great booming city with quick transportation available to Downtown Chicago for other internship opportunities. North Central staff, faculty, and administrators truly care about their students are are much more than professional staff; they are colleagues and friends.

textAfterTable: Sarah from Newburgh, IN 06/15/2009 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 8 out of 8 people found this review useful. 2 of 28 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Those who care about academics but want a welcoming, fun atmosphere Tips for prospective students Visit campus and see just how nice Naperville is to live. The admissions team was really friendly and helpful both on the telephone and when I visited campus! Bang for the buck Although the tuition is not cheap, merit aid scholarships were very helpful in my case. Will enjoy being here The area around the campus is downtown Naperville and includes a great place to take walks (the Riverwalk), shopping, and restaurants. Since this college is close to Chicago, there are also nearly endless things to do within a 45 minute drive or train ride. Will learn a lot
